It was around 9 in the morning at Ashford Academy when C.C. was suddenly awoken by a loud grumbling. Sitting up and pushing off her covers, the green-haired girl, dressed only in a bra and panties, placed a lithe hand upon her flat stomach. She waited several seconds before it groaned again, as if it were crying out. She was hungry.

'Hmm...' C.C. yawned, 'I guess I should have breakfast then...'

Lelouch had already left, persumably for some food, so C.C. was all alone in the bedroom. The immortal girl crossed her arms and legs and stared off into the distance as she tried to decide what to do now. Her stomach was demanding to be filled, but she was still feeling rather sleepy as well.

'I could really go for some pizza...'

12.content: How shall the fiery redhead get larger than life?
12.title: Kallen Stadtfeld/Kozuki

choices: Kallen goes for a walk around town to clear her head

121.content:
It had been a year since Lelouch Lamperouge had willingly died for the sake of both Britannia and Japan.

At first, Kallen had been happy living a life of peace, and getting to attend school like a normal teenage girl. However, after a whole year, Kallen had slipped into a state of boredom and laziness. As much as she hated to admit it, she had actually enjoyed a life of combat, and the adrenaline rush that came with it. She wanted to be able to fight again, if only for the sake of having something interesting to do. Unfortunately, there was no hope in that ever happening again.

In a half-hearted attempt to ease her boredom, Kallen began to eat more, most of it being high-calorie snacks like chips and cookies in particular. During the weekends she would spend hours lying on the couch, staring at the TV, all the while shoving handfuls of greasy potato chips down her gullet. Her boredom also resulted in laziness, and the only time she ever got any real exercise was during gym class. Because of these factors, the redhead had begun to grow a little flabby in the belly area. It was hardly visible, but there was a slight jiggle in the underside of Kallen's stomach.

"Ugh...I've seen this crap already..." Kallen grunted under her breath as she changed the channel for the tenth time in the last two minutes. Two family-size bags of potato chips and a case of oreo cookies laid empty on the floor, and she was currently digging her right hand through a third bag of chips. Crumbs and grease were splattered all over her face, which had recently grown more puffy. She just couldn't stop eating.

There didn't seem to be anything interesting on the TV, but Kallen still sat there watching. She was just so bored...so, so bored...
121.title: Kallen's Laziness

choices: She runs into an old friend

Yet another chip had just passed Kallen's lips when she realized that there was something else she could do to alleviate her boredom since there was nothing good on TV. It was so simple, really.

"I'll take a walk...!" she proclaimed aloud.

For the first time that weekend, Kallen threw on her shoes, buttoned up her jacket, and went outside for some fresh air. She took the bag of chips with her just in case.
1211.title: Kallen goes for a walk

The slightly chubby redhead exited the door and went her way through the city. She had to admit, despite it being a bit chilly, the fresh air did feel nice. Soon after, her tummy growled with hunger. She opened the bags of chips she had and munched on them as she continued on her walk. Things had gotten pretty peaceful in Japan. No longer refered to as Elevens, the Japanese felt their pride restored.

As she made her way deeper into the center if the city, she saw a glimpse of green pass through the corner of her eye. She turned in the direction of it to see that it just passed around the corner. The girl rushed to the corner, a nostalgic feeling coming over her. As she turned she saw the green-haired witch...

1212.content:
Kallen let out a loud, unladylike burp as she finished the last of the potato chip bag. She carelessly tossed it to the floor along with the other two bags of chips and the box of cookies that had also been emptied out earlier. Groaning, the redhead placed her hands upon her stomach, feeling how taut the small bulge was. She belched again, and it was followed soon after by a tiny fart. She had never eaten so much at once before like this.

'I know I'm stuffed,' she thought, rubbing her stomach, 'But I still feel peckish...I wonder why?'

Her boredom and desire for excitement was making her constantly hungry for food. Since eating this much wasn't helping her, it seemed that her only choice was to eat even more!

"Okay, binging time". Kallen licked her lips and examined all the food. She decided to start on the selection of cheeseburgers stored within, tearing into them with a voracious hunger. Each burger was devoured fiercely, Kallen imagining she was a wild animal teairng into her prey. This helped satisfy her desire for action as well as her interest in eating.
She finished off the cheeseburgers and attacked the potato chips next, eating at a swift pace. She felt an odd ecstasy at being able to eat so much, and loved every moment. The potato chips disappeared, followed by chocolate bars, party pies, candy and a few blocks of butter. Grease covered her clothes from where she had wiped her hands, and crumbs were all over her shirt, flabby face, steadily growing double chin and also growing bust.
Finally, the cupboard was bare, and Kallen sat back, a satisfied grin on her face. Her belly had long popped out of her clothes, pushing her shirt up to just below her breasts and popping her jeans, which had fallen off. Her underwear seemed to be under a bit of stress, but Kallen didn't mind at all. However, when she tried to move from her seated position on the ground, there was an issue. The masive binge had rendered Kallen's movement largely ineffective.
"Oh, what do I do now?"
121211.title: Junk Food Galore

choices: Kallen lets it digest and sees the results
1212111.content:
Kallen sat and thought for a while. There was so much more junk food to be had, and she had plenty of money to spend. There was a great fast food restaurant in town, renowned for its fatty foods... and it delivered, as well. Kallen shrugged and smiled, flipping up her mobile phone and dialling the number, trying as best she could with her flabby fingers.
"Who needs to move around, anyway? It's so overrated" she said as her call went through. She was salivating at the prospect of all the food she could order...
Half an hour later, her massive delivery had arrived and she set about eating it all, with a ravenous joy. She barely seemed to have time to swallow, tearing through the burgers at an incredible rate. Each one was ripped apart, wolfed down and sent down to her heavily expanded stomach, adding steadily to the rolls of fat her body now carried. She crammed handfuls of fries into her mouth as fast as she could, wiping away the grease on her over-stretched underwear or, as her belly expanded to cover her panties, on her growing gut, giving it a shiny look. Pizza followed, each slice dripping with cheese and coated heavily in fatty meats. As she consumed each piece of junk food, Kallen's belly grew and grew. Her breasts had swelled to well beyond the size of a basketball, and she was growing a third and fourth chin. Kallen scoffed down her dessert of ice-cream, chocolate bars, candy and even a special treat made almost entirely from pure fat, designed to boost gaining.
Finally, it was all over. Kallen patter her belly and gave a small burp, then tried to stand up. It was no good - her body was far too heavy. The fat on her legs was beginning to cover her feet, and her belly stretched out quite a way, to the ends of her legs. Kallen was truly immobile, but she didn't seem finished yet.
"Awwww... all that fat hasn't covered my feet yet" Kallen observed. "I want to be fatter... but maybe I ought to let this settle and see where it goes".

12513.content:
(The start of this story follows that of the anime. Lelouch has just killed his brother Clovis La Britannia, and helped the rebels succeed against britannia and acquire some equipment.)

Lelouch enters the classroom, and is met with the ecstatic chatter of some girls in the classroom. "Kallen! It's been ages! Are you okay?". A realization strikes Lelouch as he looks at Kallen, sitting by her desk. The girls continue to talk, but Lelouch pays no heed to them, now stuck in thought.. Of course, I thought she looked familiar. He sits down, quietly concentrated and assessing the situation. Having someone amongst the rebels that knows him personally is risky, even if she is mostly absent from school. If she recognized him, it would jeopardize all his plans.

Lelouch's train of thought is broken, as Rivalz leans over to him. "Watcha looking at, my dear Lelouch? Might you have a crush on her?" He says jokingly. "Just thinking this is a rare event, she hasn't been here since the term started." No doubt busy partaking in guerrilla warfare, he thinks to himself.

Something needs to be done. I could use Geass, but what do I command her to do? Killing her is out of the question. What else could I command her to do? Can I ask her to back down, live a life separate from the rebels? How will the geass last? What happens when it's duration ends? A lot of questions haunts Lelouch as the day passes at a snail's pace. These are not simple issues to deal with, certainly. But he cannot stand by and do nothing.

------------------------

Lelouch spots Kallen outside, hiding behind a bush. A quick look-around reveals she hid from a bee. He walks over to her, not yet quite sure what to do. Kallen kills the bee with a quick hand strike, with impressive reflexes. Lelouch slows down, approaching silently. Kallen speaks as if to herself: "..wish I didn't have to act like a freaking invalid!". It had to be her! She turns to him, her sandwich held in her mouth. In that moment, Lelouch thinks of a solution. Force her to leave the rebels, and test the limitations of my geass. She is the perfect candidate! "C-can I help you?" she looks visibly frustrated, and her expression even reveals a hint of fear. Lelouch smiles with confidence. "Yes." He activates Geass.

"Kallen Stadtfield..."

125131.title: The terms of the geass

1251311.content:
(The day passes, Lelouch comfirms that geass can only be used once on each person, and he makes preperations in order to correct his blunder from yesterday.)

Lelouch watches Kallen in the corner of his eye. Just like he expected she is snacking on a chocolate bar, doing her best to be discrete. He smirks, content that his original orders are being adhered to. He has made a pretty solid assumption on how his geass works, and he has set in motion a plan in order to convince Kallen that the mention of Shinjuku was completely coincidental. Everything is going according to plan.

The class ends, and the pupils disperse. Most leave to attend other matters, though some linger in the classroom to converse casually. Lelouch walks over to Kallen. "Could you come with me, please? I'd like to talk to you." Kallen stands up, and to the amazement of some of her peers responds; "Yes.. I was expecting you'd ask me to".

They head to the student council club house. And though Lelouch does his best to make the conversation sound lighthearted, like there's no hidden agenda behind his behavior, Kallen still eyes him with suspicion. "So we won't be disturbed here?" She asks. "Excactly."

"There it is! Found it! This is it, right?" Shirley's voice is heard from above, her voice being carried seemingly from the top of the stairs. As if on que, Lelouch thinks to himself. Kallen looks around, then at Lelouch, surprised that the studint council arrives. Lelouch acts the same way. Kallen is completely unaware, that this is all a part of a carefully thought-out plan. Then Milly Ashford, the head of the student council enters. In front of her, is a vast amount of food.

"Umm.. what is all of this?" Asks Lelouch, even though he already knows the answer.

"Didn't you bring her here because you knew? It's because we are letting Kallen into the student council." .. "My grandfather asked us to." She concludes.

The student council all introduce themselves. Rivalz, Shirley, Nina, Milly and even Nunally, Lelouch's sister. Kallen eyes the food infront of her with a strange hunger, though nobody seems to take notice. They all sit down to dine together, and the student council are all welcoming to Kallen, who is clearly taken back by all of this. Now, let's see just how far geass allows you to push yourself. Lelouch smiles at Kallen, but turns to Milly to compliment her on the food. He would of course not want to raise suspicion.

They all eat their fill, but only Lelouch notices the absurd amount of food that Kallen is able to consume. Eating at a steady pace, she barely finds time to talk, and she keeps eating long after everyone else has had their fill. Her expression reveals that it's now painful for her to continue eating. But geass will not let you stop, just yet! Lelouch supresses a grin as Kallen devours another plate filled with pasta, barely taking the time to wipe the sauce off her chin using her sleeve. But she doesn't stop yet, she can't stop yet. She pours the last of the pasta on her plate. "Wow, you were really hungry, huh?" Says Milly in a friendly voice. Kallen looks shocked, as if just realizing what she is doing. "Uhm, I guess so. And it seemed a waste to leave this delicious food uneaten". "Thanks, I'm glad you liked it!" Milly responds joyfully. The council shares more laughs and stories as Kallen finishes her last plate, finally being allowed to rest.

Impressive, she managed to eat it all. She looks uncomfortable, though, she must be near her limit. I'm surprised if she's even able to move after that, or if the student uniform still fits her. Lelouch catches himself staring at Kallen, fortunately before anybody else did. He pondered for a second if he was actually a bit enticed by the view, but quickly discarded such thoughts, as rivalz brings forth a bottle of champagne he had hidden away.

"This calls for a celebration!"

"Campagne?" Shirley asks reluctantly.

Nina follows up. "Student council members can't drink!"

"Oh, loosen up, you guys!" Rivalz starts removing the cork, but is abruptly interrupted by shirley.

"We're not allowed to drink that!" She graps the bottle, trying to force it out of Rivalz' grip.

He twists it out of her grip. "Lelouch, catch!" the bottle flies through the air, and Lelouch barely manage to catch it. But accidentally the cork falls out, and Kallen is soaked in the alchoholic beverage. Just as planned.

The unsuspecting redhead can do little but sigh, as the champagne seeps through her clothes. She tries to get up, but finds that the table is now blocking her abnormally large gut. Oh my, did I really eat that much?! She thinks to herself.

"I'm so sorry!" Exclaims shirley as she readjusts herself on the chair. "We'll wash your clothes and give a new set right away!"

Kallen rubbed her pathetically overstuffed belly. She sighed, as this meant she had to get out of her seat.

15111.content:
Lelouch Lamperouge (really, Lelouch vi Britannia- wasn't that more fitting now?) sat at his desk in his room in the Student Council Club House at Ashford Academy. He sat with his hands on the empty wood, palms turned up, staring at them, not quite believing they were real. They still looked like his old hands, the hands that wrote the answers to tests and moved chess pieces across the board and tucked his sister Nunally in at night. They weren't his old hands, though- not really, not any more.

Now they were the hands of a murderer.

Killer, he forcefully corrected himself. Clovis' death was justified after what he did. He was butchering those Japanese!

But that wasn't why Lelouch had killed him, was it? Lelouch hadn't killed his older half-brother, the now late Governor-General of Area 11, to avenge the slaughtered Japanese of the Shinjuku ghetto. Clovis la Britannia had died because he'd been part of the vicious and wicked apparatus that was the Holy Britannian Empire, the apparatus that had killed his mother and crippled his sister. Lelouch had killed Clovis because he hated Clovis and all the rest of his relations in the Britannian royalty- his father, the Emperor, most of all. It had been an act of his own vengeance.

And it wouldn't have been possible without this power...

The strange power that green-haired girl had given him as she lay dying at his feet. The 'Power of the King,' she'd called it.

Geass.

With it, he could give anyone any order and they would obey it without question, without hesitation. There appeared to be some limitations- he couldn't use it more than once on a person, and he had to make direct eye contact for it to take effect; there were probably more that he hadn't yet discovered. Even so restricted, the power he now possessed was frightening and exhilarating. He'd gotten a taste of what it promised in the ghetto- the ability to seize control of vital resources and information, to put into his hands the tools he had longed to use. Now the revenge he had dreamed of could be realized; he could at last pay out the wages of his long hatred.

He glanced across the room, to his bed. The standard issue military sidearm was there, the one he had taken from the woman whose Knightmare Frame he had commandeered. His violet eyes sharpened on it. That was the pistol he had used to kill Clovis- the first death by his hand. He would not be the last.

Lelouch put his palm against his pale forehead, his long, delicate fingers running through his unruly mop of black hair. Just remembering what he'd gone through in the past twelve hours wore him out. He loved to have his mind challenged, normally; it was an almost erotic thrill for events to pull his brain in many directions at once, to apply himself to multiple problems simultaneously and tackle them all with skill. This new business was weighty, though. It was more than anything he could have prepared himself for.

There came a knock upon his door. "Lelouch? Nunally said you were in here! Hellooooo!"

Lelouch whirled around in his chair, surprise and annoyance spiking at the voice. It was Milly Ashford, granddaughter of the Academy's master, President of the Student Council- of which Lelouch was Vice President, a position he had been granted by Milly herself. "Oh, hullo President."

"Tch, don't be so formal, Vice President! People will think we're having a spat!" She tried to open his door. "C'mon, Lulu, open up! We missed you at the meeting today!"

"Oh... I got stuck in all the mess around Shinjuku. Didn't Rivalz tell you?"

"That was hours ago, Lulu! You could have let us know you were all right; Shirley was worried sick!" She tried his door again.

"Well, I'm fine, so there's no need to bother with me," Lelouch said.

"Now I'm really going to have to come in," Milly said. She tried his door one more time. "I mean it, Lelouch, I'm coming in!"

Of course she was. Milly had managed to convince her grandfather to give her one of the school's master keys; Lelouch's lip curled at the thought of her barging in-

The gun! His heart nearly stopped. The gun was lying right on his bed! The lock turned even as he began to panic; there was no time to hide it! He wondered if he could convince Milly not to report it. No- not with something as serious as a gun. Milly allowed him many liberties, but she would not overlook a firearm on school grounds, certainly not in the hands of a student.

The doorknob turned. The door opened. He had to do something quick!
15111.title: Fateful Ashford Academy Day

choices: Go to the Academy lunch room.
151112.content:
Milly stepped enthusiastically into the room. Her wavy blond hair flew around her shoulders at her dramatic movements; her bright blue eyes practically sparkled. She was a few inches taller than Lelouch. "Now, Lulu, you're wanted in court! Come leap to your defense!"

Lelouch almost bounced across the room; in one long step he was standing at the doorway, blocking Milly's view inside. She tried to sidle past him, but he moved with her, keeping her from getting by. "I'm sorry for missing the meeting," he said quickly, putting on what he hoped was a disarming smile. "Now I've got a migraine, so-"

"Lulu, you never get migraines! Come on, what's going on in here?" Milly asked. She gave him a saucy wink. "Were you pleasuring yourself?"

"Wha- No! No, for heaven's sake, no!" Lelouch was so shocked by the insinuation that he drew back in horror, his face flushing scarlet. It gave Milly enough room to slide past him, her considerable bosom brushing against his chest as she entered. Lelouch knew he was doomed.

Unless... He really hated to do it. He liked Milly quite a bit, and had hoped to keep her and the rest of his friends at the Academy out of his plans. Besides, he didn't think it was a good idea to go around wasting his power on trivial matters. But this was life and death- he couldn't let her discover what he'd been up to! That decided it. "Milly!"

She had just been about to turn toward his bed; now she looked back at him. "Yes?"

Lelouch looked her in the eyes. His left pupil shimmered; in it there flashed a wing-shaped sigil, gleaming red. Now, what shall I send her off with? It can't be anything she could take dangerously. I don't want her to act suspiciously. Ah! Smiling, he spoke fateful words: "Go eat something!"

Milly's pupils grew large, and faintly glowing rings of red shone around them. She smiled a small, placid smile, and nodded. "All right," she said gently. She pivoted toward the door; Lelouch stepped out of her way, and she walked out of his room without a backward glance.

Lelouch waited until he heard the door to his and Nunally's rooms close. He closed the door to his room and locked it again. Then he sat down on his bed, cradling his head in his hand. "Whew!" he breathed. "That was too close." He immediately set about hiding the gun, as well as finding a better hiding place for the soldier's armor he had stolen during the battle.

Milly, meanwhile, strode purposefully across the upper floor of the Club House, humming gently as she went. She wasn't quite sure why, but all of a sudden her appetite was raging fiercely. She had only eaten lunch a few hours ago, but now she felt hungry enough to down a five-course meal! She walked down the grand staircase and made her way out to the grounds. Food, food, food, she needed food. But where to get it?
151112.title: The Power of the King

1511121.content:
Milly strode resolutely across the grounds of Ashford Academy; the Geass placed on her had filled her with firm purpose. She was going to have something to eat. What shall I have, though? Ooo, there's so much to choose from! She could get something from the vending machines, or she could peruse the items being served today for lunch.

Then she recalled the lavish dinner her family had had the past Sunday. She knew there was some left. Milly thought greedily of the beef tenderloin with its marinade and accompanying mustard sauce. That would hit the spot! She cut across a field.

Arriving at her family's home within the Academy's grounds, Milly burst through the double doors and hurried through the entrance hall; into the sitting room, through the dining room with its long table, she finally reached the kitchen. She was practically drooling by this point. The girl's blue eyes bulged when they lit upon the ice box. Sliding it open, Milly sifted among wrapped raw meats and bagged produce until she found the shelf where the tenderloin still sat, whittled down to one quarter of its original size. She took out the platter; diving back in, she retrieved the scalloped potatoes and the green beans that had gone with the meat.

Milly was licking her lips by the time she had removed the meat's cellophane cover. She ladled the remainder of the potatoes and the green beans onto the empty portion of the platter and popped the ensemble into the light oven. Humming gently under her breath, she slid open the wine pantry as her food cooked, looking up and down the stacked bottles until she found the delicious Cabernet they'd drank at that lunch. She pulled it out, popped the cork, and was just pouring herself a glass as the timer for the oven went off.

Still humming, Milly carried the large plate out to the dining room, setting it at the head of the table. She went back to the kitchen for the wine and some silverware. She sat down and rubbed her hands together; it smelled as good as it had on Sunday! She was just picking up her fork, when she stopped, feeling she'd forgotten something. Ah! she snapped her fingers. The mustard! She quickly returned to the kitchen, and after a few minutes of rooting, produced the small boat with the brown-yellow sauce inside. Milly returned to the table shaking with excitement. The Geass was pressing hard upon her mind, nearly driving her into a frenzy to start eating. She poured the mustard all over the tenderloin, cut a bite, and began!

"Ohhhh..."

"Mmmmm..."

"Mmmm, delishush!" she said with her mouth full. It was so good! Somehow even better than it had been when it was fresh! She tried to savor every bite, but she was ravenous, so she ate quickly. Nevertheless, there was a lot of meat. So she ate, and ate, and ate, with some drinking at the side.

A little more than an hour later, Milly was soaking the last bite of tenderloin in the last of the mustard sauce. With a contented smile she stuck her fork in her mouth, chewed slowly, reverently, and swallowed. The last bit of potatoes went down right after, and then a final gulp of wine. She leaned back in her chair. "Ahhh... Urp!" she belched softly, covering her mouth as she did. She had eaten the entirety of the remaining food. Her stomach was so full she thought she might burst, but it had been so good. She'd eaten so much her school skirt felt tight around her swollen middle.

Completely full, indeed, stuffed to the gills, Milly had finally fulfilled Lelouch's command. The glowing red rims around her pupils vanished, and the slight alteration of her mind reverted to normal. Wiping her mouth with a napkin, Milly surveyed the empty platter with a little puzzlement. What had come over her? It wasn't normally like her to eat between meals, certainly not to the extent of eating more than she would at lunch or dinner. "Oh, well," she shrugged, "it was good." She yawned. "Ooof! I think I need to go digest..."

Rising from her chair, Milly cradled her swollen stomach tenderly as she made her way through the house, up the stairs to the second floor. Coming to her room, she gently set herself back on her bed, not even bothering to take off her shoes. She yawned again, rolled over on her side, and was soon asleep.
